doc.title: Li Auto
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Li Auto DG to Neutral headwind in the near term cut EPS and PO to USD26Li Auto DG to Neutral headwind in the near term c_2025-08-29

passages.text: Rating Change: NEUTRAL | PO: 26.00 USD | Price: 22.60 USD

We downgrade Li Auto (Li) to Neutral from Buy following its 2Q25 results, as the company guided lower sales volume/GPM in 3Q25. Management guided 90- 95k units of vehicle delivery \((- 41\%\) to \(- 38\%\) YoY) and \(19\%\) gross margin in 3Q25. We believe the latest guidance echoes the intensified market competition, which will weigh on Li's sales growth outlook. We cut 2025/26/27E volume sales by \(12\% /12\% /8\%\) , and lift OPEX to sales by 2.1/2.1/1.5ppt. Net- net, we cut our 2025/26/27E non- GAAP earnings by \(38\% /33\% /31\%\) . We cut our PO to USD26/ADS or HKD101 (was USD31/HKD121) mainly on lowered sales and FCF.

Management expects the accumulated delivery of i8s will reach 8- 10k units by end Sep. It will launch i6, the 5- seater electric SUV, which features unique design, long driving range, and more internal space and meets the preferences of the younger generation. Looking forward, management plans to reduce the number of SKUs and focus on each model, with the strongest competitiveness and cost- effectiveness. Li will accelerate the model update and technology iteration to stay competitive versus peers.

Li Auto is very profitable in the family use SUV segment but in recently months more new products have been launched in the segment: Xiaomi YU7, AITO's M8/M7, and Onvo L90. In our view, Li may consider stepping into other segments like sedans or be more aggressive in oversea markets to resume its fast growth path, as China's EV market growth may slow down soon due to its high base. We expect i6 to be a popular product, while it is hard to avoid the cannibalization with L6. We anticipate L6/L7/L8/L9 will resume good sales momentum with improved GPM likely in 2Q26, when the new generation of the L series is to be launched.
\\* For full definitions of \(\Delta \mathrm{op}_{0.00}^{0.00}\) measures, see page 9.

Key Metrics \\* For full definitions of iQmethod measures, see page 9.
Autos/Car Manufacturers

Li Auto was founded in 2015, and it mainly manufactures and sells premium smart electric vehicles (EVs). Li Auto is the first Chinese auto company to sell Extended- Range Electric Vehicles (EREV) in China. Li Auto was listed on the Nasdaq in July 2020.

We have a Neutral rating on Li Auto. On one hand, we see sales volume growth and margin pressure in 2H25 given intense market competition in China. However, we also favor its strong technology reserve in autonomous driving (e.g. VLA model), which may translate into new products with strong competitiveness.
Shares / Common Price to Book Value
Key Changes(CNY)PreviousCurrentInv. OpinionC-1-9C-2-9Inv. RatingBUYNEUTRALPrice Obj.HK$121HK$1012025E EPS3.682.052026E EPS4.993.232027E EPS5.683.87

Li's 2Q25 sales came in at RMB30.2bn, down \(4\%\) YoY/up \(7\%\) Q2. 2Q25 sales volume read 111k units, up \(2\%\) YoY/20% QoQ, while ASP was down \(7\%\) YoY/2% QoQ to RMB260k. Overall GPM was up 0.6ppt YoY/down 0.5ppt QoQ at \(0.1\%\) , lower than our forecast of \(20.4\%\) . Vehicle GPM came in at \(19.4\%\) Q0.7ppt YoY/down 0.4ppt QoQ. The YoY vehicle GPM improvement was helped by the Q0.5t reduction measures. OPEX- to- sales ratio came in at \(17.3\%\) , down 0.7ppt YoY/0.1ppt QoQ, and largely in line with our expectation. Non- GAAP earnings came in at RMB1.5bn in 2Q25, down \(3\%\) YoY/up \(44\%\) QoQ, missing our estimates but in line with the market consensus.

As of July 2025, Li Auto had 535 retail stores in 153 cities in China, 527 servicing centers and Li Auto- authorized body and paint shops in 222 cities, and 3,028 super charging stations in operation equipped with 16,671 charging stalls. Li Auto has been conducting a reorganization since April 2025 of its sales and marketing departments. As of now, the headquarter is in charge of and monitors 23 regional departments. The company also added sales & operation and marketing departments, restructured the store location selection team, and strengthened the sales personnel training team and car delivery team.

Li Auto considers 2025 as the pivotal year for overseas expansion. The company has established R&D centers in the US and Germany. Currently, it is constructing its overseas sales network and IT infrastructure. For the new models under design that are scheduled to unveil in 2026, the company has been considering customer appetite and local regulations. Looking forward, Li Auto will focus on expansion in the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and Europe.

As of August 2025, Li Auto has applied the VLA (Vision Language Action) Driver Large Model to its i8 customers. The i8 is equipped with VLA preview version, which includes VLA driving, VLA summon, and VLA parking functions. The VLA model features 4bn parameters, which is 10 times more than that of regular end- to- end model. From Sep 2025, the company will launch its VLA model to all AD Max existing users through OTA 8.0. In 2025, Li Auto will invest over RMB6bn in developing artificial intelligence. Li Auto is currently testing is self- developed chip and plans to launch in 2026. Management also believes with the VLA model is crucial in achieving L4/L5 autonomous driving.

We derive our PO of USD26 per ADS (HKD101 per share) using an average of EV/sales valuation and DCF valuation, vs. previously USD31 per ADS (HKD121).

DCF- based fair value: We derive a fair value of USD22.2 (was USD27) from our DCF calculation, with assumptions of \(2\%\) FCF perpetuity growth and discount rate (WACC) of \(13.9\%\) (previously \(14.0\%\) , due to change of capital structure).

EV/sales- based fair value: We derive a fair value of USD29 (was USD35). We apply an unchanged target EV/sales multiple of \(1x\) (unchanged) to 2H25- 1H26E sales. Our target multiple of \(1.0x\) is 1 standard deviation below historical average one- year forward EV/sales since the IPO and is in line with other EV companies.
Exhibit 5: Valuation summary Our new PO is USD26/ADS or HKD101

Valuation methodologyImplied valueUpside/downsideParametersMethodology 1EV/Sales (USD)29.01x EV/salesMethodology 2DCF (USD)22.2WACC of 13.9%Price Objective (rounded) (USD)26.08%Price Objective (rounded) (HKD)101.015%
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
We derive our PO of USD26 per ADS (HKD101 per share) using an average of EV/sales valuation and DCF valuation

DCF- based fair value: We derive a fair value of USD22.2 from our DCF calculation, with assumptions of \(2\%\) FCF perpetuity growth. For WACC, we use a \(4.0\%\) risk- free rate, \(12\%\) market return and Beta of 1.3 to calculate and derive the discount rate (WACC) of \(13.9\%\)

EV/sales- based fair value: We derive a fair value of USD29. We apply a target EV/sales multiple of 1x to 2H25- 1H26E sales. Our target multiple of 1x is 1 standard deviation below historical average one- year forward EV/sales since the IPO, and is in line with other EV companies.
Upside risks: faster than expected overseas expansion, successful new electric models launch.
Downside risks: weak macro, competition from other brands, raw material cost hike.

methodis the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and validations. The key features of
method are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls.

tables* is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts' earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research.
Profile, method are service marks of Bank of America Corporation. ttable* is a registered service mark of Bank of America Corporation.

FUNDAMENTAL EQUITY OPINION KEY: Opinions include a Volatility Risk Rating, an Investment Rating and an Income Rating. VOLATILITY RISK RATINGS, indicators of potential price fluctuation, are: A - Low, B - Medium and C - High. INVESTMENT RATINGS reflect the analyst's assessment of both a stock's absolute total return potential as well as its attractiveness for investment relative to other stocks within its Coverage Cluster (defined below). Our investment ratings are: 1 - Buy stocks are expected to have a total return of at least \(10\%\) and are the most attractive stocks in the coverage cluster; 2 - Neutral stocks are expected to remain flat or increase in value and are less attractive than Buy rated stocks and 3 - Underperform stocks are the least attractive stocks in a coverage cluster. An investment rating of 6 (No Rating) indicates that a stock is no longer trading on the basis of fundamentals. Analysts assign investment ratings considering, among other things, the 0- 12 month total return expectation for a stock and the firm's guidelines for ratings dispersions (shown in the table below). The current price objective for a stock should be referenced to better understand the total return expectation at any given time. The price objective reflects the analyst's view of the potential price appreciation (depreciation).
Investment ratingTotal return expectation (within 12-month period of date of initial rating)Ratings dispersion guidelines for coverage clusterR2Buy≥ 10%≤ 70%Neutral≥ 0%≤ 30%UnderperformN/A≥ 20%
R2Ratings dispersions may vary from time to time where BofA Global Research believes it better reflects the investment prospects of stocks in a Coverage Cluster.

INCOME RATINGS, indicators of potential cash dividends, are: 7 - same/higher (divided considered to be secure), 8 - same/lower (dividend not considered to be secure) and 9 - pays no cash dividend. Coverage Cluster is comprised of stocks covered by a single analyst or two or more analysts sharing a common industry, sector, region or other classification(s). A stock's coverage cluster is included in the most recent BofA Global Research report referencing the stock.

Short- term trading ideas and recommendations may be more or less positive than a stock's fundamental equity rating.
